'Allotransplantation' (allo- from the Greek meaning "other") is the
transplantation of cells, tissues, or organs, to a recipient from a genetically
non-identical donor of the same species. [http://www.ehealthmd.com/library/-
acltears/ACL_surgery.html#allograft Surgery For ACL Tears] The transplant
is called an 'allograft', 'allogeneic transplant', or 'homograft'. Most human
tissue and organ transplants are allografts.

An immune response against an allograft or xenograft is termed rejection. An
allogenic bone marrow transplant can result in an immune attack termed Graft-versus-
host disease.
